result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt H Egerer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the $200.00 cash bond on file be applied to the fine and costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kurt H Egerer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:32 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 2 with a fine and costs and count 1 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2.  Court orders count 1 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court adjourned at 11:37 a.m.

9:56 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - requests a Jury Trial date and a status prior to the Trial.  Court will set for Status Hearing on September 22, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.  All motions and witness lists are to be filed by September 15, 2015 and motions will be addressed at the status hearing.  Jury trial date will be given at the Status Hearing date.

Court adjourned at 9:57 a.m.

9:11 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Pribat - has a tentative offer and requests an adjournment.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on August 24, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:12 a.m.

11:21 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.   Statement by Atty Privat - requests one more status hearing.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on July 20, 2015 at 9:00 a.m .

Court adjourned at 11:22 a.m.

11:56 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - requests some more time.  Court will set for Status Hearing on June 23, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:56 a.m.

1:48 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court advises regarding DNA and expungement.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation - $200 cash continue.  Court sets bond at $200.00 cash bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 27, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:50 p.m.
